definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To stroke or fondle (an animal ).
examples: I really love to pet cute puppies.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , intransitive , informal ) To stroke or fondle (another person) amorously .
examples: We started petting each other the moment we were alone.

definitions.definition: ( dated , transitive ) To treat as a pet; to fondle ; to indulge .
examples: His daughter was petted and spoiled.

definitions.definition: ( archaic , intransitive ) To be a pet.
( archaic , intransitive ) To be peevish ; to sulk .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To stroke or fondle (an animal ).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , intransitive , informal ) To stroke or fondle (another person) amorously .
( dated , transitive ) To treat as a pet; to fondle ; to indulge .
( archaic , intransitive ) To be a pet.
( archaic , intransitive ) To be peevish ; to sulk .

definitions.definition: To be petulant or upset ; to have a problem with.

main_definition: To be petulant or upset ; to have a problem with.
